intro: Psychotria alba f. glabrata, commonly known as the white Psychotria or the smooth-leaved Psychotria, is a variant of the Psychotria genus native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a shrub characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are typically consumed by various bird species. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. Due to its unique appearance and potential ecological roles, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
